question: After implantation, finger-like projections appear on the trophoblast called ______.
Chorionic villi are surrounded by ______ and maternal blood.
The chorionic villi and uterine tissue jointly form a structural and functional unit called ______.
The placenta facilitates the supply of ______ and nutrients to the embryo.
The placenta also removes ______ and excretory/waste materials produced by the embryo.
The placenta is connected to the embryo through an ______ which helps in transport of substances.
Placenta acts as an endocrine tissue and produces hormones like ______, hPL, estrogens, and progestogens.
In the later phase of pregnancy, the hormone ______ is secreted by the ovary.
hCG, hPL and relaxin are produced in women only during ______.
During pregnancy, levels of hormones like estrogens, progestogens, cortisol, prolactin, and ______ increase several-folds in maternal blood.
Increased production of these hormones supports fetal growth, metabolic changes in the mother, and ______ of pregnancy.
